p: The plants of the Lamiaceae and Asteraceae families are widely distributed medicinal plants throughout the world and have been used since ancient times for medicine and food. Historically, medicinal plants from these families have been used for flavoring, food preservation and medicinal purposes, due to their bioactive properties [ 1, 2, 3]. Today, pharmaceutical companies are interested in the wide range of beneficial properties of these plants in order to develop modern herbal remedies that would be used either as a replacement or supplement to conventional medicines and for prevention of illnesses [ 4, 5, 6]. In addition, medicinal plants are valuable raw material for perfumery and cosmetics, but also for healing purposes in self-medication [ 7, 8, 9], as well as in organic agriculture [ 10, 11, 12].
